Package frc.robot

Class Lib4150PositionControl

java.lang.Object
frc.robot.Lib4150PositionControl
public class Lib4150PositionControl extends Object
Position Control closed loop Controller. This is similar to a PD controller with the added functionality of an error deadband, a minimum output value, and clamped maximum / minimum output.
File: LIB4150PositionControl.java

Referenceable items: (classes)
LIB4150PositionControl

Depends on:
none - no external libraries required

Operating system specifics:
None - transportable

Notes:

  • Constructor Details

    • Lib4150PositionControl

      public Lib4150PositionControl(double errorDeadband, double errorThreshold, double outputDeadband, double outputThreshold, double maxOutput, double Kd, boolean filterDerivative, boolean negateOutput)
      Construct a Lib4150PositionControl object. Slope and offset are calculated from the error deadband, error threshold, output deadband and output threshold. Often maxOutput is set to the same value as output threshold.
      Parameters:
      errorDeadband - - double - error deadband value.
      errorThreshold - - double - error threshold value.
      outputDeadband - - double - output deadband value.
      outputThreshold - - double - output threshold value.
      maxOutput - - double - absolute value of maximum allowed output.
      Kd - - double - derivative tuning parameter is multiplied to the derivative, which is added to the output.
      filterDerivative - - boolean - filter the derivative when Kd is non-zero.
      negateOutput - - boolean - after all calculations negate the calculated output. Used where motors are reversed.

  • Method Details

    • setTuning

      public void setTuning(double errorDeadband, double errorThreshold, double outputDeadband, double outputThreshold)
      Set new tuning parameters based on the Deadband and Threshold points. Slope and offset are calculated from these values. Often the maximum output will be set to the same value as outputThreshold, however this is not required.
      Parameters:
      errorDeadband - - double - error deadband value.
      errorThreshold - - double - error threshold value.
      outputDeadband - - double - output deadband value.
      outputThreshold - - double - output threshold value.

    • setVirtualLimits

      public void setVirtualLimits(double fwdLimit, double revLimit)
      Set virtual forward and reverse position limits.
      Parameters:
      fwdLimit - - double - value of the forward position limit. Output will not exceed zero when the position is greater or equal to this value.
      revLimit - - double - value of the reverse positin limit. Output will not be below zero when the position is less or equal to this value.

    • setMaxOutput

      public void setMaxOutput(double maxOutput)
      Set maximum output. This has no effect on the tuning. The output is limited to be within +/- of this value. Often this is set to the same value as output threshold.
      Parameters:
      maxOutput - - double - value of the maximum allowed output.

    • setDerivativeTuning

      public void setDerivativeTuning(double Kd, boolean filterDerivative)
      Set derivative tuning.
      Parameters:
      Kd - - double - Derivative gain constant. If this is zero, derivative term will not be used.
      filterDerivative - - boolean - If TRUE, the derivative will be filtered by averaging the last 3 raw derivative values. This can help smooth the control.

    • setNegateOutput

      public void setNegateOutput(boolean negateOutput)
      Set negate output
      Parameters:
      negateOutput - - boolean - if TRUE the output will be multiplied by -1.0.

    • setDesiredOnTargetCount

      public void setDesiredOnTargetCount(int desiredOnTargetCount)
      Set on target count
      Parameters:
      desiredOnTargetCount - - int - sets number of consecutive execution cycles that the error must be within the error deadband before the system is considered to be on target. This does not effect control action.

    • setContinuous

      public void setContinuous(boolean continuousInput, double minInput, double MaxInput)
      Set if the input is continuous. When continuous is set to true the input value wraps from the maximum input to the minimum input. This is useful for controlling the position of a rotational system.
      Parameters:
      continuousInput - - boolean - Set to TRUE if this is a continuous system.
      minInput - - double - minimum allowed input value. Modulus values are calculated when the value is below this value.
      MaxInput - - double - maximum allowed input value. Modulus values are calculated when the value is above this value.

    • getPositionError

      public double getPositionError()
      Get position error
      Returns:
      positionError - double - current position error.

    • getOnTarget

      public boolean getOnTarget()
      Get on target status
      Returns:
      onTarget - boolean - returns TRUE when position error has been within error deadband consecutively for the defined number of execution cycles.

    • getFwdVirtualLimit

      public double getFwdVirtualLimit()
      Get forward virtual limit value
      Returns:
      fwdLimit - double - forward virtual limit

    • getRevVirtualLimit

      public double getRevVirtualLimit()
      Get reverse virtual limit value
      Returns:
      revLimit - double - reverse virtual limit

    • getMaxOutput

      public double getMaxOutput()
      Get max output tuning value. The output is clamped to be within +/- of this value.
      Returns:
      maxOutput - double - maximum allowed output.

    • getSlope

      public double getSlope()
      Get slope tuning constant. This is the value calculated for the straight line output ramp. It it is calculated from error deadband, error threshold, output deadband, output threshold. If the error deadband and output deadbands are set to zero, this controller becomes a PID control with this slope = Kp. (Ki is always zero.)
      Returns:
      slope - double - get tuning slope (Kp)

    • getOffset

      public double getOffset()
      Get offset tuning constant. This is the value calculated for the straight line output ramp. It it is calculated from error deadband, error threshold, output deadband, output threshold.
      Returns:
      offset - double - get tuning offset

    • getErrorThreshold

      public double getErrorThreshold()
      get tuning error threshold value. This along with the error deadband, output deadband, and output threshold are used to calculate the slope of the output ramp.
      Returns:
      errorThreshold - double - value of error threshold

    • getErrorDeadband

      public double getErrorDeadband()
      get tuning error deadband value. When error is within +/- of this value the output is set to zero. Also the on target count is incremented. This along with the error threshold, output deadband, and output threshold are used to calculate the slope of the output ramp.
      Returns:
      errorDeadband - double - value of error deadband.

    • getOutputThreshold

      public double getOutputThreshold()
      get tuning output threshold value. This along with the output deadband, error deadband, and error threshold are used to calculate the slope of the output ramp.
      Returns:
      - outputThreshold - double - output threshold tuning value.

    • getOutputDeadband

      public double getOutputDeadband()
      get tuning output deadband value. When the error exceeds the error deadband the output jumps from zero to this value (or minus this value based on sign of the error. ). This term accounts for friction of the system. This along with the output threshold, error deadband, and error threshold are used to calculate the slope of the output ramp.
      Returns:
      outputDeadband - double - output deadband tuning value.

    • getKd

      public double getKd()
      get deriative gain tuning constant Kd.
      Returns:
      Kd - double - derivative gain constant.

    • getFilterDerivative

      public boolean getFilterDerivative()
      gets tuning value indicating that calculated derivative will be filtered by averaging the last 3 calculated derivatives. This can be used to smooth a noisy system allowing the derivative term to provide useful control.
      Returns:
      filterDerivative - boolean - returns TRUE when derivative filtering is enabled.

    • getNegateOutput

      public boolean getNegateOutput()
      get negate output tuning value. When true the calculated control output is negated.
      Returns:
      negateOutput - boolean - When TRUE calculated control output is negated.

    • getDesiredOnTargetCount

      public int getDesiredOnTargetCount()
      get consecutive on target count tuning value requred to set on target value.
      Returns:
      OnTargetCount - int - number of consecutive times system must be within error deadband to be considerd on target.

    • getContinous

      public boolean getContinous()
      get system is continuous tuning value.
      Returns:
      continuous - boolean - system is continuous. Max input value wraps to min input value.

    • getMinInput

      public double getMinInput()
      get minimum allowed input tuning value.
      Returns:
      minInput - double - minimum allowed input tuning value.

    • getMaxInput

      public double getMaxInput()
      get maximum allowed input tuning value.
      Returns:
      maxInput - double - maximum allowed input tuning value.

    • PosCtrlExec

      public double PosCtrlExec(double targetPos, double actualPos)
      Calculate control output for the given control error.
      Parameters:
      targetPos - - double - desired position.
      actualPos - - double - measured position.
      Returns:
      controlOutput - double - calculated control output.

    • PosCtrlExec

      public double PosCtrlExec(double ctrlError)
      Calculate control output for the given control error.
      Parameters:
      ctrlError - - double - control error ( desired position - actual position )
      Returns:
      controlOutput - double - calculated control output.

    • PosCtrlExec

      public double PosCtrlExec(double targetPos, double actualPos, boolean fwdLimitReached, boolean revLimitReached)
      Calculate control output for the given control error and limit switch values.
      Parameters:
      targetPos - - double - desired position.
      actualPos - - double - measured position.
      fwdLimitReached - - boolean - TRUE when forward limit has been reached.
      revLimitReached - - boolean - TRUE when reverse limit has been reached.
      Returns:
      controlOutput - double - calculated control output.

    • PosCtrlExec

      public double PosCtrlExec(double ctrlError, boolean fwdLimitReached, boolean revLimitReached)
      Calculate control output for the given control error and limit switch values.
      Parameters:
      ctrlError - - double - control error ( desired position - actual position )
      fwdLimitReached - - boolean - TRUE when forward limit has been reached.
      revLimitReached - - boolean - TRUE when reverse limit has been reached.
      Returns:
      controlOutput - double - calculated control output.
